patterns: Tell me about Ceylon Electricity Board
responses: Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) is the state-owned electricity company in Sri Lanka. It generates, distributes, and supplies electricity to homes and businesses across the country.
CEB, also known as the national power utility, is responsible for electricity generation, transmission, and distribution in Sri Lanka.

patterns: What can I do with Ceylon Electricity Board?
responses: CEB offers a range of services including electricity supply, billing, new connections, energy efficiency programs, and more.
CEB's services encompass electricity distribution, metering, customer support, and initiatives to promote energy conservation.

patterns: How can I contact Ceylon Electricity Board?
How do I reach CEB's customer service?
responses: You can contact CEB's customer service at 011 2440316 or dgmp@ceb.lk. Visit our website for more contact details.
To reach CEB's customer service, you can call us at 011 2440316 or send an email to dgmp@ceb.lk. Additional contact information is available on our official website.

patterns: Are there any planned power outages?
Tell me about current power outages
Is there a power outage in my area?
responses: You can check for current power outages on the [CEB Outage Map](https://cebcare.ceb.lk/Incognito/OutageMap).
Open Outage Map: /open_outage_map

patterns: What is CEB's electricity import process?
responses: CEB imports electricity to meet peak demand and ensure a stable supply. Imports are sourced from neighboring countries.
Electricity imports play a crucial role in ensuring a reliable energy supply. They are obtained through agreements with neighboring countries.
Vision of CEB is Enrich Throught Power.
Mission of CEB is To develop and maintain an efficient
coordinated and economical system of electricity supply to the whole of Sri Lanka
while adhering to our core values quality
service to the nation
efficiency and effectiveness
safty
professionalism
sustainability
commitment
